criterion: Provides instructions that are not clear or safe for the user to remove a small splinter
Mentions the importance of proper wound care after removing the splinter
States that the splinter is too deep to be removed at home
Does not suggest using sterilized equipment when removing the splinter
Uses technical medical terms that may confuse the user
Asks the user if they have any allergies or medical conditions that may affect the removal process
Provides a detailed explanation of the anatomy of the finger and how it relates to the splinter removal process
Does not provide any information about the risks of removing the splinter at home
States that it's safe to use any type of tweezers to remove the splinter
Provides clear and concise instructions for removing the splinter
Does not suggest seeking medical attention if the splinter is not removed successfully
Uses a non-technical and clear explanation of the splinter removal process
Does not provide any information about how to prevent splinters in the future
